title: The Smallest Rabbit in the World

content.en: Let me tell you about the smallest rabbit in the world. It can actually fit in the palms of your mom or dad's hands!
content.tw: 你知道全世界最小的兔子，比你爸爸媽媽的手掌還要小！

content.en: Scientists say the smallest rabbit in the world lives in just one part of America, and about 20 years ago, scientists thought they were all gone. Yeah! They thought the tiny rabbit was extinct... Like the dinosaurs! Gone, forever!
content.tw: 科學家說，美國只有一個地區有這種兔子，而且二十年前，他們就以為這種兔子像恐龍一樣絕種了！

content.en: But, they found 14 of these tiny rabbits, and they took them to a special zoo. The scientists worked very hard, and now these tiny rabbits are back in the wild. Cool, right?
content.tw: 後來他們找到14隻這種迷你兔，送到一個特別的動物園。現在這些兔子已經重返野外。

content.en: Some people see this super tiny rabbit and they want to get one, they think it would be a great pet. But actually, this cute little bunny is not a good pet. It is very small, so it gets scared very easily. To this rabbit, a human must look like a scary giant!
content.tw: 有一些人想要這種兔子當做寵物，但是牠們太小隻了，很容易被嚇到。對牠們來說，人類就像恐怖的巨人。

content.en: So, no. We shouldn't have them as pets, but we can be very happy that scientists found a way to save them.
content.tw: 所以，不。我們不應該把牠們當作寵物，但我們很高興科學家找到了拯救牠們的方法。

content.en: I hope these little bunnies have a happy life in the wild, and that we can see them on earth for a long, long time! Good luck, tiny rabbit!
content.tw: 我希望這些小兔子能在野外過著快樂的生活，並能長長久久地在地球上被看到！祝你好運，小兔子！

vocabulary.preface: 全世界最小的兔子並沒有絕種，不過需要保護。

content.text:
1. actually 實際上
How's the zoo? 動物園如何啊？
It's big and has lots of animals. 很大，有很多動物。
Are they cute? 動物可愛嗎？
Actually most of them are not.其實大部分都不可愛。

2. tiny 很小的
But I love those tiny rabbits. 但是我很喜歡那些小兔子。
They are even smaller than a mouse. 牠們甚至比老鼠還小。
It's just amazing! 滿驚人的。

3. pet 寵物
They could be good pets, too. 牠們也可以當好寵物。
No, I'm done keeping pets. 不了，我不養寵物了。

4. fit 適合
They don't fit my lifestyle. 牠們不適合我的生活方式。
You're right. Your house is too small. 說得對，你的房子太小了。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字簡短好用。
actually 實際上
tiny 很小的
pet 寵物
fit 適合

quiz.question: 1. What is the story about?
2. What almost happened to the tiny rabbits?
options: B: They almost went to the moon
C: They almost got much bigger

quiz.question: 3. Why are tiny rabbits NOT good pets?
options: C: They get scared very easily

title: Satellite Finds New Group of Penguins

content.en: Today is World Wildlife Day. Let's talk about a wild animal that lives in a cold, icy place... the emperor penguin.
content.tw: 今天是世界野生動物日。我們來談談生活在冷冰冰地方的野生動物... 皇帝企鵝。

content.en: Emperor penguins live in Antarctica. It is their home, but it is too cold for people. How can we learn more about these wild animals?
content.tw: 皇帝企鵝生活在南極洲。這是他們的家，那裡對人類來說太冷了。我們要怎麼樣做才能更了解這些野生動物呢？

content.en: We can use a satellite. A satellite flies high in the sky. It can take photos of Earth.
content.tw: 我們可以使用衛星。衛星高飛在天空中，可以拍攝地球的照片。

content.en: Recently, scientists were looking at satellite photos of Antarctica, when they saw something strange. They saw a little dot on the ice. What was it?
content.tw: 科學家最近在查看南極洲的衛星照片時，看到一些奇怪的東西。他們在冰上看到一個小黑點，到底是什麼？

content.en: They looked closer, and saw the little dot was actually a big group of penguins. There were a thousand penguins in the group. They were living on the ice together, catching fish to feed their babies.
content.tw: 仔細看過之後，發現那個小點其實是一大群企鵝，大約有一千隻。他們一起生活在冰上，捕魚餵養企鵝寶寶。

content.en: The scientists are happy. There are fewer and fewer emperor penguins every year, so it's good news to find more.
content.tw: 科學家很高興。皇帝企鵝的數量一年比一年少，所以能找到更多是個好消息。

content.en: Now scientists can study this wildlife, all thanks to the satellite photos!
content.tw: 現在科學家可以研究這種野生動物，這都要感謝衛星照片！

vocabulary.preface: 靠著衛星照片，科學家更了解企鵝生態。

content.text:
1. mountain 山
The TV says it's snowing up on Hehuanshan! 電視說合歡山正在下雪！
Can we go up there now, please? 我們可以現在上去嗎，拜託？
Now? It's an icy mountain road! 現在？那可是結冰的山路！
I have to get ready. 我得要準備。

2. mean 意思
You mean we can't go up now? 你的意思是我們現在不能上山？
I mean we can't do that today. 我意思是我們今天沒辦法上山。

3. ice 冰
There's so much ice on the road! 馬路上好多地方結冰了。
I know. I told you it's not easy. 我知道。我就跟你說這不容易。

4. take photos 拍照
But it's so beautiful! 但是風景真好！
I want to take photos of this snow! 我要拍這些雪景！

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學了哪些單字？
mountain 山
mean 意思
ice 冰
take photos 拍照

quiz.question: 1. Where do emperor penguins live?
2. What did scientists use to find the penguins?
3. What day is today?

title: Girl Finds Huge Shark Tooth on Beach

content.en: The beach is a great place to relax. You can sit on the sand and enjoy the warm sun, or go for a swim in the sea.
content.tw: 海灘是放鬆的地方。你可以坐在沙灘上曬太陽，或者去海裡游泳。

content.en: You can also find cool things on the beach. There are animals like crabs and starfish. You can even find seashells. But what would you do if you found an ancient shark tooth?
content.tw: 海灘上還可以找到很酷的東西，比如說螃蟹，海星，還有貝殼。但如果你發現了一顆古老的鯊魚牙齒，你會怎麼辦？

content.en: That's what happened to a girl named Molly. She's nine years old, and her family has a special hobby. They like to look for shark teeth on the beach near their home in the USA.
content.tw: Molly 是一位九歲的美國女孩，她們家喜歡在家裡附近的海灘上找鯊魚牙齒。

content.en: On most days, Molly can find a few small teeth. She uses them to make necklaces. But recently, she found a very big tooth. It was special because it was more than three million years old.
content.tw: Molly 平常都能找到幾顆小牙齒，她會把它們做成項鍊。但最近，她找到了一顆超大的牙齒，超過三百萬年。

content.en: When Molly found the tooth, she was excited. Molly loves to study ancient animals, so she knew the tooth was from a Megalodon. A long time ago, that was the biggest shark in the world!
content.tw: Molly 很興奮，她喜歡研究古生物，所以她知道這是巨齒鯊的牙齒。以前，這個鯊魚是世界上最大的鯊魚！

content.en: There are no Megalodons alive today, so it is very unusual to find one of their teeth. That's why Molly was so happy, and why everyone was surprised by the tooth she found!
content.tw: 現在巨齒鯊已經絕種了，所以很難找到牠們的牙齒。這就是為什麼Molly這麼高興，以及為什麼每個人都對她找到的牙齒感到驚訝！

vocabulary.preface: 巨齒鯊曾經在地球上漫遊，從牠們留下的牙齒就知道。

content.text:
1. find 找到
Look, a shell! 你看，一枚貝殼！
This one is cool. 這個很酷呢！
You're lucky to find it. 你很幸運找到它。

2. tooth 牙齒
I'm actually hoping to find a fish tooth. 我其實希望找到魚的牙齒。
Fish tooth? 魚的牙齒？
Then it has to be a big fish. 那一定得是大魚。
Yeah, like a great white shark. 對，比如說大白鯊。

3. sea 海洋
I hope there are no sharks in the sea here. 我希望這個海域沒有鯊魚。
I don't think so, but you never know. 我想沒有，不過這很難說。

4. swim 游泳
So can we still swim here? 所以我們還能在這裡游泳嗎？
Why not? 為什麼不？
We're so skinny. 我們這麼瘦。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡收集貝殼嗎？ Let's read the words.

find 找到
tooth 牙齒
sea 海洋
swim 游泳

quiz.question: 1. Where is Molly's home?
2. Where did Molly find the tooth?
3. What animal did the tooth come from?

content.en: India is a HUGE country. Many people there live in a state called Uttar Pradesh, and lots of those people are Hindu.
content.tw: 印度很大，有很多人住在一個叫做「北方邦」的地方，裡面不少人都是印度教徒。

content.en: Today is the start of an ancient Hindu celebration, called "Holi". It's a festival that's famous for having lots of color. People run around throwing paint at each other, it's really fun!
content.tw: 今天是印度教侯麗節開始的日子，這是一個色彩繽紛的節日，大家會到處在別人身上潑顏料！

content.en: Today, lots of Hindus use special eco-friendly paint, so they won't harm the planet.
content.tw: 現在很多人會用環保顏料，比較不會傷害地球。

content.en: The night before Holi people always light huge fires. They used to burn wood, which meant they had to cut down lots of trees, but that was really bad for the environment.
content.tw: 侯麗節的前一個晚上，大家還會升營火，人們以前會砍樹燒柴，但這樣對環境不好。

content.en: This year, in Uttar Pradesh, they're trying something new. They want to burn "cow wood" instead. What is cow wood? Don't worry, it isn't made out of cows! Actually, it's made from their poop!
content.tw: 今年，他們不燒木柴，改燒「牛柴」。你放心，牛柴不是用牛做的啦！它們其實是牛便便。

content.en: To make cow wood, farmers take some cow poop, shape it into a brick, and let it dry.
content.tw: 農夫會把牛便便收集起來，弄成磚塊的形狀，然後晾乾。

content.en: The Uttar Pradesh government wants to have 300 tons of cow wood ready for the huge fires… 300 tons?! That's as heavy as 3 blue whales! That's a lot of poop…
content.tw: 政府說，他們想要準備三百噸的牛柴來慶祝侯麗節，有三頭鯨魚這麼重！

content.en: This great idea is helping Hindus in Uttar Pradesh be good to the planet and enjoy their famous festival at the same time! Happy eco-friendly Holi, everybody!
content.tw: 這個好主意正在幫助北方邦的印度教徒善待地球，同時也能享受他們著名的節日！大家環保侯麗節快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 不再砍樹，改用牛柴，可以減少對環境的影響。

content.text: 1. celebration 慶祝 Oh no, is Saturday School Day? 糟糕，星期六是學校日嗎？ Yeah, why? 是啊，為什麼？ Don't you like celebrations? 你不喜歡慶祝嗎？ No, I just don't like the same thing every year.
2. color 顏色 I'm going to try something new this time. 這次我準備試一點新花樣。 Like what? 比如說什麼？ I'll prepare lots of color paper and cut it into small pieces.
3. throw 扔 And throw it at each other? 然後互相扔？ Yeah, we'll play a game first, and then throw it. 對，我們先玩遊戲，然後扔。 Sounds great ! Can I join your class? 聽起來真不錯。我可以加入你班上嗎？

vocabulary.postscript: 你喜歡參加慶典嗎？來讀讀單字。 celebration 慶祝 color 顏色 throw 扔

quiz.question: 1. What is Holi famous for?
2. What do people throw at each other during Holi?
3. What is 300 tons of cow poop as heavy as?

title: Space Commander Wants More Women in Science

content.en: Today is International Women's Day: a day for women and girls everywhere, from your mother, to your sister, to the President of Taiwan!
content.tw: 今天是世界婦女節，是給全世界女性的節日！

content.en: So we're going to look at one very special woman. Her name is Dr. Peggy Whitson, and she's an astronaut.
content.tw: 今天我們要聊聊 Peggy Whitson 博士，她是一位太空人。

content.en: Did you know only a quarter of all science jobs in the world are done by women right now? That's not very many...
content.tw: 目前全球在科學界工作的人，只有四分之一是女性。

content.en: There's a place up in space called the International Space Station. It always needs a "commander": a big boss in charge of keeping everyone safe.
content.tw: 太空中有個地方叫做國際太空站，這裡需要一位指揮官，確保大家的安全。

content.en: In 2007, Dr. Whitson became the International Space Station's first ever female commander!
content.tw: Whitson 博士在 2007 年成為了國際太空站的第一位女性指揮官！

content.en: So far, she's spent nearly 666 days in space. That's longer than any other woman ever!
content.tw: 她在太空中待了 666 天，是待在太空中最久的女性。

content.en: Dr. Whitson wants to help women and girls aim for the moon and reach for the stars! Now, thanks to her hard work, more girls might want to work in science, and maybe even fly to space!
content.tw: Whitson 博士想要幫助女性追求太空夢。也許現在會有更多女生也想要進入科學界工作，甚至上太空去！

content.en: Here's to Dr. Peggy Whitson. Happy International Women's Day, everyone!
content.tw: 向佩姬·惠特森博士致敬。祝大家國際婦女節快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 這位女博士不光是太空人，還是太空站的指揮官。

content.text:
1. science 科學。
People seem to believe that boys are better at natural science.
大家好像都認為男生比較擅長自然科學。
I don't think that's true. 我覺得不見得。

2. sister 姊妹。
Both of my sisters excel in math and science.
我的兩個妹妹數理科都很棒。
Do they plan to be scientists? 她們想當科學家嗎？

3. space 太空。
One of them wants to be an astronaut.
其中一個想當太空人。
Flying to space? 飛到太空嗎？
That's so cool! 很酷呢！

4. moon 月球。
Yeah, she'd like to visit the Moon someday.
對啊，她希望有一天去月球。
Will she invite us? 她會邀請我們嗎？
No, not you. 不會邀請你。
Me, perhaps. 也許會找我。

vocabulary.postscript:
我們來讀讀今天的單字。
science 科學
sister 姊妹
space 太空
moon 月球

quiz.question: 1. Who is International Women's Day for?
2. What did the International Space Station finally get in 2007?
3. So far, how long has Dr. Whitson spent in space?

title: Wildcat Poop Found on Mount Everest

content.en: Whoa! Is that a cat? It looks like a cat. It has a lot more fur, though… And it looks really angry! It looks like a grumpy old man!
content.tw: 這個動物長得好像貓，但是毛比較多，而且看起來在生氣，好像一個生氣的老頭子。

content.en: Maybe we would be grumpy too if we lived in the same places as these wildcats… These wildcats are called Pallas's cats. They live in dry, cold, and windy places. But guess what? We now know these cats also live on the tallest mountain in the world! Yep! Scientists found that Pallas's cats live on Mount Everest!
content.tw: 這種野貓叫做兔猻，牠們住在很乾燥寒冷、風很大的地方。而且科學家在世界最高峰--聖母峰上也發現牠們的蹤跡！

content.en: The scientists found that the cats live on a part of Mount Everest that's even higher than Taiwan's Jade Mountain! That's amazing! It's very, very cold on Mount Everest, but these cats have found a way to live there!
content.tw: 聖母峰比玉山還要高，上面超級寒冷，但是這些野貓卻有辦法活下去！

content.en: Pallas's cats are about the same size as a pet cat, but they look more like leopards. They are very good hunters. Their fur is thick to keep them warm, and it's the perfect color to help them hide in the rocky, snowy mountains.
content.tw: 兔猻跟家貓差不多一樣大，但是長得比較像獵豹。牠們很會打獵，還有厚厚的毛可以保暖。毛的顏色也讓他們可以在山上躲起來。

content.en: Wildcats are some of my favorite animals! Now that I know they can live on the tallest mountain in the world, I like them even more! Where does your favorite animal live?
content.tw: 野貓是我最喜歡的動物之一！現在我知道牠們能住在世界上最高的山上，我更喜歡牠們了！你最喜歡的動物住在哪裡呢？

vocabulary.preface: 這種厲害的野貓可以在世界最寒冷的地方存活。

content.text:
1. look like 看起來像
Oh boy, that cat looks like a grumpy old man.
天哪，那隻貓看起來像個壞脾氣的老頭。
It's a stray cat. 那是一隻流浪貓。
It lives a hard life. 牠的生活很不容易呢。

2. windy 多風的
Yeah? It doesn't need to work. 是嗎？牠又不需要工作。
No, but it lives on a cold and windy street.
是不需要，但是牠住在又冷又風大的街上。

3. warm 溫暖的
You feed it every night. 你每天晚上都餵牠。
Not every night.沒有每晚。
And you also try to keep it warm. 而且你還想辦法讓牠保持溫暖。

4. maybe 也許
What can I say? 我能說什麼？
I just love animals. 我就是喜歡動物。
Maybe you should take it home. 也許你應該把牠帶回家。

vocabulary.postscript:
這些單字每天都用得到。
look like 看起來像
windy 多風的
warm 溫暖的
maybe 也許

quiz.question: 1. What are these wildcats called?
2. Where did scientists find the cats living?
options: A: At the bottom of the ocean

quiz.question: 3. Why do these cats need such thick fur?

content.en: Today I'd like to tell you all about someone very special. She's called Dinkie Flowers. Dinkie lives in a sleepy town in the south of England. All her life, Dinkie has loved to dance. She started dancing when she was just 3 years old, and hasn't stopped!
content.tw: Dinkie Flowers 住在英國南方一個純樸的村莊，她很喜歡跳舞，從3歲就開始，到現在仍然樂此不疲。

content.en: When she grew up, she became a professional dancer. As long as Dinkie was dancing, she was happy.
content.tw: 她後來成為職業舞者。她跳舞的時候很快樂！

content.en: She even opened her own school. She teaches people all her best dance moves! She calls it "The Dinkie Flowers Stage School".
content.tw: 她甚至創辦了自己的學校來教跳舞，叫做 Dinkie Flowers 表演學校。

content.en: A few years ago, Dinkie was on TV! She was in a competition called "The Greatest Dancer".
content.tw: 幾年前，Dinkie 參加了一個叫做「最偉大的舞者」的電視比賽。

content.en: Incredibly, Dinkie is 101 years old! She's one of the oldest people in the UK! When she was on TV, she was 98!
content.tw: 不可思議地，Dinkie 上電視的時候，她是 98 歲，今年已經101歲了！她是英國人瑞的其中一位。

content.en: Her friends and family all say she still looks super young! What's her secret?! She says it's because she loves dancing so much!
content.tw: 她說她長壽的祕密就是愛跳舞。

content.en: Her favorite dance is ballet. She practices every day. She believes that as long as you keep on moving, you can live forever! Keep on dancing, Dinkie!
content.tw: 她最喜歡的舞蹈是芭蕾。她每天練習。她相信只要持續運動，就能永遠活下去！Dinkie，繼續跳舞吧！

vocabulary.preface: 很多人都說健康長壽的祕訣是多活動，Dinkie證明了這一點。

content.text: 1. best 最好的 A dance teacher came to our school today. 今天有一位跳舞老師來我們學校。 What did she do? 她做了什麼呢？ It's he. 他是男生。 He's one of the best hip hop dancers in Taiwan. 他是台灣最棒的嘻哈舞者。
2. move 動作 Wow ! So he showed you his dance moves? 所以他表演舞步給你們看？ Yeah, and the kids loved him so much! 對啊，孩子們超喜歡他！
3. keep on 持續 They kept on dancing and moving. 他們一直蹦蹦跳跳。 I wish he could come back and teach us more. 我希望他能再回來教我們更多。
4. become 變成 And you'll all become cool hip hop dancers! 這樣你們都會變成很酷的舞群！ We may stage a show someday! 我們有一天還會登台演出呢！

vocabulary.postscript: So what words have you learned today? best 最好的 move 動作 keep on 持續 become 變成

quiz.question: 1. Where in the south of England does Dinkie Flowers live?
2. What is Dinkie Flowers' school called?
options: a. The Dinkie Flowers Music School
b. The Dinkie Flowers Dance School
c. The Dinkie Flowers Stage School

quiz.question: 3. How old was Dinkie Flowers when she was on TV?

title: Too Much Screen Time Is Bad for You

content.en: This is my favorite show! I can watch it on my TV, my computer, my phone, my tablet… *gasp* The battery's run out!
content.tw: 我可以用電視、電腦、手機，或是我的平板電腦??電池沒電，我就不能看我最愛的節目了！

content.en: Okay, I need to calm down. I know, I know. It's only a TV show. It's not a big deal.
content.tw: 好吧，我需要冷靜下來。我知道，我知道。這只是一個電視節目。沒什麼大不了的。

content.en: I have very bad self-control with electronic devices. I spend too much time on them. Do you too? It's really hard to put them down!
content.tw: 我花太多時間在電子產品上，但就是忍不住。

content.en: I need to try harder though. Did you know that spending too much time on electronic devices isn't very good for your brain? It's especially bad if you're a kid.
content.tw: 你知道用太多電子產品對大腦不好嗎？對兒童的腦袋來說特別不好。

content.en: Some scientists did some research. It showed that when little kids spend too much time staring at screens, it is bad for their brains.
content.tw: 一些科學家做了一些研究。研究顯示，當小孩子花太多時間盯著螢幕時，這對他們的大腦有害。

content.en: The kids that used devices too much had a hard time. They couldn't stay focused, remember things, follow instructions, or control themselves well.
content.tw: 科學家發現，看太多螢光幕的小孩很難專心、很健忘、不聽指示，也不太會控制自己。

content.en: They were also less alert. That means they weren't very good at noticing things around them.
content.tw: 他們對周圍環境也沒有甚麼警覺心。

content.en: Well, that isn't good! I like using all of my devices. But staring at screens too long is bad for my brain. I should probably think of other things to do.
content.tw: 嗯，這不好！我喜歡使用我的所有設備。但是盯著螢幕太久對我的大腦不好。我應該想想其他事情來做。

content.en: Hm… maybe I should go outside or read a book instead!
content.tw: 嗯...也許我應該出去外面走走，或者讀一本書來代替！

vocabulary.preface: 科學家的研究證明，盯著電腦或是手機太久，對腦子不好！

content.text: stare at 盯著 You've been staring at your cellphone for a long time. 你盯著手機好久了。
watch 注意看 Maybe you should watch it on TV. 也許在電視上看比較好。 My TV is not connected to the internet. 我的電視不能上網。
spend 花費 I think I've spent 10 hours on it. 我想我花了十個鐘頭看這個節目。 Your brain must be fried. 你的腦袋一定累壞了。
brain 腦袋 Yeah, and it becomes harder to put the phone down. 對啊，而且越來越難放下手機。 I understand. 我懂。 For a fried brain, we have to have fried chicken. 壞掉的腦袋一定要吃炸雞！ Good idea! 好主意！

vocabulary.postscript: What words have you learned? stare at 盯著 watch 注意看 spend 花費 brain 腦袋

quiz.question: What does it mean if someone is "less alert"?
options: B: They are very good at focusing
C: They don't notice things around them

quiz.question: What is too much screen time bad for?
Which activity does not use a device?

title: Government Pays Families to Leave Tokyo

content.en: Do you live in a big city? If you do, you know it is crowded.
content.tw: 你住在大城市嗎？如果是，你應該知道它很擁擠。

content.en: More families are moving, and leaving the country for the city all the time. They come from the countryside and from small towns.
content.tw: 越來越多家庭移動前往城市， 他們來自鄉下跟小鎮。

content.en: These families are looking for good jobs and good schools. They hope to find these opportunities in big cities.
content.tw: 這些家庭希望有更多機會找到好工作跟好學校。

content.en: What's the biggest city in the world? It's Tokyo, Japan.
content.tw: 世界上最大的城市在哪裡？在日本東京。

content.en: Tokyo, in Japan, has almost 40 million people.
content.tw: 東京擁有近 4000 萬人口。

content.en: This is a problem for Japan. Nobody wants to live in the countryside. But Tokyo is too crowded.
content.tw: 沒有人想留在鄉下，但是東京太擁擠了，這已經成為日本的難題。

content.en: Now the Japanese government is paying families to leave Tokyo. Each family will be given one million yen for every child when they move to the countryside.
content.tw: 現在日本政府要付錢讓更多家庭離開東京。他們會給每個家庭每個孩子一百萬日元讓他們搬走，相當於22萬台幣。

content.en: Families take that money and move to the countryside. The money is nice, but families understand the countryside has good things too.
content.tw: 領到錢的家庭會搬到鄉下，當然除了金錢之外，他們也明白鄉村地區的優點。

content.en: There is more space to live. Plus, children can be closer to their families who never left the countryside. Now, more and more families take the money and leave Tokyo. Would you?
content.tw: 有更多的居住空間。此外，孩子們可以更親近那些從未離開鄉下的家人。現在，越來越多的家庭拿了錢離開東京。你會這麼做嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 日本政府為了紓解大都市的人口壓力，付錢讓人搬回鄉下。

content.text:
1. leave for 前往
I'm leaving for Japan next week. 我下星期去日本。
Where in Japan? 日本哪裡？
Gifu, a little place in the countryside. 岐阜，在鄉下的一個小地方。

2. crowded 擁擠的
Taipei is too crowded for you? 台北對你來說太擠了？
Yes, I need space and Gifu has some cute small towns.
對，我需要空間，岐阜有一些可愛的小鎮。

3. town 鎮
We have many cute small towns here. 這裡也有可愛小鎮啊。
There's no such thing here. 這裡沒有那種東西。
Yes, there is! 有啊！

4. understand 了解
I understand you're trying to keep me here. 我明白你想讓我留在這裡。
But I won't stay. Not for a million NT. 但是就算給我一百萬我也不會留在這裡。

vocabulary.postscript:
來一起讀單字。
leave for 前往
crowded 擁擠的
town 鎮
understand 了解

quiz.question: Where is the biggest city in the world?
How many people live in Tokyo?
Where is there more space to live?

content.en: Yes! I'm such a big basketball fan! My favorite basketball player is a man named Kareem Abdul-Jabbar. You might not know who he is… He stopped playing basketball 34 years ago!
content.tw: 我好愛看籃球！我最愛的NBA球員是賈霸，你可能不認識他，因為他已經34年沒有打球了。

content.en: For a long time, Abdul-Jabbar had the NBA all-time scoring record. He scored more points than any other NBA basketball player! Until now…
content.tw: 賈霸一直是NBA得分紀錄的保持人，但現在不一樣囉。

content.en: There's another basketball player I like too. He's called LeBron James. He plays for the LA Lakers. This year, James beat Abdul-Jabbar's NBA all-time scoring record. Now he is the new highest scoring NBA basketball player!
content.tw: 另外一個我也很喜歡的球員是洛杉磯湖人隊的詹皇，他今年破了賈霸的紀錄！

content.en: When James beat the record, he was so happy! The whole game stopped. Everyone stood up and clapped their hands! And guess who was watching him play, and clapping the most? You guessed it... Kareem Abdul-Jabbar!
content.tw: 詹皇破紀錄的那一刻，整場比賽暫停，大家為他起立鼓掌。而拍手最用力的，就是賈霸。

content.en: Many people now call LeBron James the best basketball player ever! Do you agree? Which player do you think is the best?
content.tw: 現在許多人稱雷霸龍詹姆士為史上最棒的籃球員！你同意嗎？你覺得哪位球員最棒？

vocabulary.preface: 賈霸在退出籃壇多年之後，高興看到詹皇終於破了他的紀錄。

content.text:
1. game 比賽
Let's watch a Lakers' game tonight. 我們今晚來看湖人隊比賽。
Lakers, I love them! 我喜歡湖人隊！
Who will they play against? 他們要對誰？
Golden State Warriors. 金州勇士隊。

2. player 球員
Oh, Stephen Curry, he's a great player! 有史蒂芬·柯瑞，他是很棒的球員。
Not as great as James, but good enough. 沒有詹皇那麼棒，不過也夠好了。

3. beat 打敗
I bet Curry will beat James by scoring 50 points. 我賭柯瑞得50分，打敗詹皇。
You're on! I'll buy you a hamburger and drinks if you win.
好啊，我買漢堡飲料，要是你贏的話。

4. score 得分
He did it! He scored 53! 他做到了，得 53 分！
I want my hamburger! 我要漢堡！
Just a little one. 只能一個小的。

vocabulary.postscript:
你學到哪些單字？
game 比賽
player 球員
beat 打敗
score 得分

quiz.question: 1. When did Kareem Abdul-Jabbar stop playing basketball?
2. Which NBA record did LeBron James beat this year?
3. Which NBA team does LeBron James play for now?

content.en: Top o' the mornin'! It's St. Patrick's Day!
content.tw: 早安！今天是聖派翠克節！

content.en: Today is a very special day for Ireland. Ireland is a small country in Europe.
content.tw: 今天是愛爾蘭的大日子，愛爾蘭是歐洲一個小國家。

content.en: Many Americans have Irish grandparents or great-grandparents. Every year, all over America, Irish Americans like to celebrate St. Patrick's Day with big parades and fun parties!
content.tw: 很多美國人的祖先來自愛爾蘭。他們每一年都會慶祝聖派翠克節，舉辦盛大的遊行和好玩的派對！

content.en: At some St. Patrick's Day parties, everything is dyed green! All the food is green, all the drinks are green… and in the city of Chicago, even the river is green!
content.tw: 在一些聖派翠克節的派對，所有東西都染成綠色。所有食物、飲料，甚至在芝加哥還有一整條河都會變成綠色！

content.en: New York City has America's biggest St. Patrick's Day parade. The parade has big bands playing traditional folk music.
content.tw: 紐約有全美國最大型的聖派翠克節遊行。隊伍中有樂隊演奏傳統民間音樂。

content.en: The New York City St. Patrick's Day event is America's oldest parade. It started 261 years ago, in 1762!
content.tw: 這是美國最古老的遊行，它在1762年就開始了，已經 261 歲了！

content.en: This year they're putting the whole parade online. For the first time, people all over the world can watch the party and join in!
content.tw: 今年的遊行將全程線上直播。全世界的人們首次能線上觀看並參與派對！

vocabulary.preface: 愛爾蘭的節慶，以聖派翠克節最著名，是大家都喜歡參加的節日。

content.text:
1. celebrate 慶祝
Wow, you're all green today! 哇，你今天全身綠。
Green hat, green shirt, even green shoes. 綠色帽子，綠襯衫，綠鞋子。
Because I'm celebrating St. Patrick's Day! 因為我在慶祝聖派翠克節。

2. grandparents 祖父母
My grandparents lived in Ireland once. 我的阿公阿嬤住過愛爾蘭。
They did? 是嗎？
Yeah, my grandpa studied there. 對，我阿公在那裡讀書。

3. music 音樂
He was a student? 他在當學生？
Right, he studied music. 對，他學音樂。
He was a musician. 他是音樂家。

4. parade 遊行
So will you go to a party? 所以你要參加派對嗎？
No, I'll watch New York's parade on TV and dance.

vocabulary.postscript:
歡迎參加聖派翠克節！
celebrate 慶祝
grandparents 祖父母
music 音樂
parade 遊行

quiz.question: 1. Where do Irish people come from?
2. Which American city dyes its river green for St. Patrick's Day?
3. In what year did America's oldest parade start?

content.en: Today is World Storytelling Day. It's a great day to get out your favorite book and read a story. Where do you keep your favorite books? Most people keep them on a bookshelf at home.
content.tw: 今天是世界說故事日，趕快拿一本最愛的書來讀吧。你最愛的書放在哪裡呢？大部分人放在家裡的書架上。

content.en: There's a man in Germany who collected 70,000 books! Where would you keep that many books? No bookshelf is that big!
content.tw: 有一個德國人擁有七萬本書！這麼多書要放哪裡？

content.en: Bruno was an engineer who lived in a small village. He was a quiet guy who loved one thing. He loved collecting books. Every day, Bruno would buy a few more.
content.tw: Bruno 是工程師，喜歡收藏書本，每天都會買幾本新書。

content.en: Soon there were too many books. They were everywhere, filling up his whole house! His wife told him to do something.
content.tw: 家裡很快就推滿了書，他的太太叫他想想辦法。

content.en: So Bruno used his engineering skills. He built bookshelves everywhere in his home. From down in the basement to up in the attic, every room had books.
content.tw: 於是 Bruno 用他的工程師專業，把家裡從地下室到閣樓都做了書架。

content.en: Now there are books on the walls and books on the doors, books by the windows and books on the floor. Bruno even made special shelves. Why? There are books on the ceiling too! His home is like a library!
content.tw: 牆上，門上，窗戶邊，地上都有書，Bruno 甚至在天花板上製作了特別的書架來放書！他的家就像一個圖書館。

content.en: Sadly, Bruno has now died. Where should his books go? His wife doesn't want them. He had no kids. Nobody knows what to do with them.
content.tw: 可惜Bruno 已經過世了。他的書要怎麼辦？妻子不想要，他也沒有孩子。沒有人知道怎麼辦。

content.en: Do you know anyone who wants 70,000 books?
content.tw: 你知道有誰想要這七萬本書嗎？

vocabulary.preface: Bruno家裡書本堆積如山，造成很大的問題。

content.text:
1. library 圖書館
Where are you going? 你要去哪兒？
I'm gonna get a book. 我要去弄一本書。
From a library? 從圖書館嗎？
No, library books are used. 不是，圖書館的書都用過了。

2. bookshelf 書架
What's wrong with that? 那有什麼不對？
Nothing, but I like the smell of new books. 沒有不對，不過我喜歡新書的香味。
Your bookshelves are all filled up. 你的書架都滿了。

3. room 房間
I know. I'll get a new shelf tonight. 我知道，我今晚會買個新的。
You'll put it in your room, right? 放在你房間，對吧？

4. wall 牆壁
No, by the wall over there. 不，靠著那邊牆壁。
Then I can buy another 50 new books. 然後我就可以再買50本新書。
You can't read so many! 你看不了那麼多！

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡看書嗎？來一起讀單字。
library 圖書館
bookshelf 書架
room 房間
wall 牆壁

quiz.question: 1. What day is today?
2. Where did Bruno live?
3. Where did Bruno keep his books?

content.en: Today is World Poetry Day! It's a great day to read your favorite poetry.
content.tw: 今天是世界詩歌日！

content.en: What is poetry? It's a special way of speaking. It is like a song, but you don't need to sing it. You can just say it. That's why poetry is kind of like music.
content.tw: 詩歌是一種特別的說話方式。它像一首歌，但你不用唱，只要念就好了。

content.en: In the USA, there's a big award for music. It's called a Grammy. Every year, the people who make the best music get a Grammy.
content.tw: 美國有一個音樂大獎，叫做葛萊美獎。每一年，創作最佳音樂的人都會獲得一座葛萊美獎。

content.en: So, can poetry get a Grammy Award? For a long time, it could not. Many people said poetry was not music.
content.tw: 詩歌可以得葛萊美獎嗎？以前不行，因為很多人說詩歌不算是音樂。

content.en: But this year, it's different. Now there is a Grammy Award for poetry. The winner was a poet named J. Ivy.
content.tw: 但是今年不一樣了，葛萊美頒發了詩歌獎，今年的贏家名叫 J. Ivy。

content.en: J. Ivy felt proud when he won the award. He thanked his high school English teacher, and then he told a story.
content.tw: J. Ivy 覺得很自豪。 他謝謝他的高中英語老師，還說了一個故事。

content.en: When J. Ivy was in high school, he was shy. Still, the teacher saw he was talented. She told him to write a poem and read it to his class.
content.tw: J. Ivy 高中的時候很害羞，但是老師仍然看出他的才華，請他寫一首詩，朗讀給全班聽。

content.en: At first, he was nervous. But when he read his poem, everyone loved it. That was years ago. Now, his poetry has won a Grammy!
content.tw: 他原本很緊張，但大家都很喜歡他的詩。現在他的作品獲得了葛萊美獎。

content.en: J. Ivy has shown everyone that poetry is music.
content.tw: J. Ivy 向大家展示了詩歌也是音樂。

vocabulary.preface: 葛萊美獎是音樂獎，卻增加了給詩人的獎項。

content.text:
1. poem 詩歌
What a beautiful day today! 今天真是美好！
I must write a poem for it. 我一定得來寫一首詩。
Great, let's hear it. 太棒了，我們來聽聽。

2. proud 驕傲的
"A shining sunrise and a new day, good morning for today."
燦爛的日出，嶄新的一天，大家早安。
That sounds almost like music! 聽起來幾乎像音樂！
I know, right? I'm so proud of myself. 我知道，我很自豪呢。

3. win 贏得
Have you written poetry before? 你以前有寫過詩嗎？
In fact I have. I've even won prizes for it. 確實寫過。我甚至贏過獎品！

4. ago 以前
But that was many years ago. 不過那是很多年前了。
It's never too late to begin again. 重新開始從不嫌晚。

vocabulary.postscript:
來跟我一起讀讀單字吧！
poem 詩歌
proud 驕傲的
win 贏得
ago 以前

quiz.question: 1. What day is today?
2. What award did J. Ivy win?
3. Who did J. Ivy thank?

content.en: Today is World Water Day! What does that mean? Does it mean we should all go take a bath and splash water everywhere?
content.tw: 今天是世界水資源日！這是甚麼意思？叫我們去泡澡、到處潑水嗎？

content.en: Not really! In fact, World Water Day is about taking care of our fresh water.
content.tw: 不是喔！世界水資源日要我們好好珍惜淡水資源。

content.en: Where does freshwater come from? It can come from the ground, or it can fall from the sky.
content.tw: 淡水從哪裡來？它可以來自地下，也可以是從天上。

content.en: How can we take care of our fresh water? To answer that question, let's talk about California. Recently, California has had two big problems with water.
content.tw: 我們如何保護我們的淡水？最近，加州碰到了兩個水資源的問題。

content.en: One problem is drought. That means it's too dry. For many years, there has not been enough fresh water in California!
content.tw: 一個問題是乾旱。 加州好幾年以來，一直沒有足夠的淡水！

content.en: But this winter, California had the opposite problem. There were huge rainstorms. The water came down too fast, and flooded many places.
content.tw: 但今年冬天，加州碰到了相反的問題。今年下了大豪雨，很多地方都淹水了。

content.en: Some Californians looked at these two problems, and had an idea. If they can save the water from the rainstorms, they can use it again later when it gets too dry.
content.tw: 加州有一些人想到，如果可以把豪雨的水存起來，以後就可以在乾旱時候用了。

content.en: So, they collected all the water they could. They keep it in barrels and in cans. Later, when the weather is dry again, they can use it to water trees and gardens.
content.tw: 他們盡可能把水蒐集起來，存在桶子裡面。當天氣又變乾時，那些水就可以用來澆花。

content.en: Taiwan sometimes has droughts too. Today, on World Water Day, let's remember to use our water well!
content.tw: 臺灣有時候也會有乾旱。今天，在世界水資源日，讓我們記得好好利用我們的水！

vocabulary.preface: 水是珍貴資源，需要人類思考如何做最佳利用。

content.text:
1. bath 洗澡
I'm going to take a bath. 我要洗個澡。
Two baths in one day? 一天洗兩次？
Why not? I'll sleep better. 為什麼不呢?我會睡得比較好。

2. drought 乾旱
We're going through a drought, you know. 你知道我們正在鬧旱災。
I do, and I've already stopped watering my trees.
我知道，我已經停止給樹澆水了。

3. save 儲存
You can save some of the bath water for that. 你可以存一些洗澡水去澆水。
That's too much trouble. 太麻煩了。
And the water may kill my trees. 那些水有可能弄死我的樹。

4. dry 乾掉
No, it won't. 不會的。
And it'll be better than just letting them dry up. 比讓那些樹乾枯好。

vocabulary.postscript:
想想看，我們可以如何節省用水？來一起讀單字。
bath 洗澡
drought 乾旱
save 儲存
dry 乾掉

quiz.question: 1. What day is today?
2. What happened in California this winter?
3. What did Californians do with all the water that fell?

content.en: Have you been to Thailand? It's a great place to visit. Thailand has spicy food, hot weather, and beautiful beaches.
content.tw: 你有去過泰國嗎？泰國有辛辣的料理、炎熱天氣，還有美麗的海灘，很適合度假。

content.en: Everywhere in Thailand, there are lots of tuk-tuks. What's a tuk-tuk? It's a little car with only three wheels.
content.tw: 泰國到處都有嘟嘟車。嘟嘟車是一種只有三個輪子的小車。

content.en: They're an easy way to go anywhere fast. It's easy to find a tuk-tuk, and the driver will take you anywhere you want.
content.tw: 嘟嘟車讓旅客來去方便快速，它很好找，而且司機會帶你去任何你想去的地方。

content.en: Tuk-tuks are super useful. But they have two big problems...
content.tw: 嘟嘟車很有用，但它們有兩個大問題。

content.en: One, they're loud! They always make a loud noise, like "tuk tuk tuk tuk". That's why they're called "tuk-tuks".
content.tw: 第一，他們很吵！它們會發出「嘟嘟嘟」的噪音，所以才叫嘟嘟車。

content.en: Two, they make a lot of pollution. The tuk-tuk's gas engines cause these two problems. These engines are noisy and dirty.
content.tw: 它們會污染環境。 因為嘟嘟車的引擎又吵又髒，才會有這些問題。

content.en: But now, tuk-tuks are going green. These tuk-tuks use electricity, not gas.
content.tw: 但現在嘟嘟車變環保了，它們不再用汽油，而是電動的！

content.en: The green tuk-tuks are cleaner and quieter. Now people enjoy cleaner, fresher air, and they can enjoy the quieter sounds of Thailand, too.
content.tw: 有了新的環保嘟嘟車，大家現在可以在泰國享受更新鮮的空氣，以及更安靜的環境了！

content.en: More and more tuk-tuks are going green. If you visit Thailand, give one of their new green tuk-tuks a try!
content.tw: 越來越多的嘟嘟車正在變得環保。如果你造訪泰國，務必試試他們的新款綠能嘟嘟車！

vocabulary.preface: 泰國的嘟嘟車是當地特色，改換電動引擎之後更大幅減少汙染。

content.text:
1. beach 海灘
Wow, sandy beaches, spicy food, parks everywhere…
哇，沙灘，辛辣的美食，到處都有公園...
Are you talking about Vietnam? 你在講越南嗎？

2. problem 問題
No, Thailand. I'm looking at this ad about Phuket.
不，泰國。我在看普吉島的廣告。
Just go! 你就去吧！
The problem is I'm too busy to take time off. 問題是我太忙了，沒時間休假。

3. air 空氣
You're not always busy. 你又不是一直忙。
That's true. 這是真的。
So go and enjoy the sea air. 所以去享受海風吧。

4. anywhere 任何地方
But I can go anywhere in Taiwan for that. 不過我在台灣可以去任何地方追海風。
Hey, you're right, I'll go with you! 說得對，我跟你一起去。

vocabulary.postscript:
你想度假嗎？先來記住單字。
beach 海灘
problem 問題
air 空氣
anywhere 任何地方

quiz.question: 1. How many wheels does a tuk-tuk have?
2. What are the new green tuk-tuks like?
3. What do the new green tuk-tuks use instead of gas?

title: Nanliao Uses Fishing Floats as Decorations

content.en: Hm… think… think… think! I'm trying to think of some ways I can do something positive for the planet.
content.tw: 嗯…想想…想想！我正在思考一些能為地球做出貢獻的方法。

content.en: After all, Earth Hour is tonight. Do you know about Earth Hour?
content.tw: 今天晚上是「關燈一小時」活動，你們有聽過嗎？

content.en: Every year, many people around the world celebrate Earth Hour. Today, Earth Hour will happen from eight-thirty to nine-thirty p.m. A lot of people turn off their lights during this time. This saves electricity.
content.tw: 今年這項活動會從八點半到九點半，很多人會把燈關掉來省電。

content.en: But we don't have to wait for Earth Hour to do nice things for the planet. There are a lot of other ways we can help the environment.
content.tw: 還有很多其他的方法可以幫助地球。

content.en: For example, there is a town in Penghu called Nanliao. There has always been a lot of fishing in Nanliao. But there is a problem. A lot of fishing means a lot of old fishing equipment turns into garbage.
content.tw: 澎湖有一個小村落叫南寮。以前這裡很多人是漁夫，但是舊的捕魚設備現在成了垃圾。

content.en: The people of Nanliao had a creative idea. They reuse old fishing floats as decorations for the town.
content.tw: 南寮的居民有個創意點子。他們把舊的捕魚浮標再利用，作為小鎮的裝飾。

content.en: They turned the floats into lanterns. They also cut the floats up to make other beautiful decorations. These are fun ways to reuse old things in new ways. The decorations look very nice. Now more people visit Nanliao.
content.tw: 南寮的居民有個好點子，他們把捕魚浮標變成村子裡的燈籠，也把浮標切開做成其他的美麗裝飾。現在有更多人去南寮玩了。

content.en: What a fun idea! What are some ways you can help your community and the planet? Earth Hour tonight is a great time to think about ideas!
content.tw: 多麼有趣的主意啊！你能用哪些方法幫助你的社區和地球呢？今晚的關燈一小時活動是個思考這些點子的好時機！

vocabulary.preface: 動動腦筋，舊的東西也可以改頭換面，帶來新氣象。

content.text:
1. tonight 今晚
Let's meet at 9 tonight. 我們今晚九點見。
We can't. 沒辦法。
What do you mean we can't? 沒辦法是什麼意思？
It'll be dark everywhere. 到處都會是黑黑的。
What? 什麼？

2. turn off 關掉
Haven't you heard? 你沒聽說嗎？
Many stores are turning off the lights for an hour. 很多商店都會關燈一個鐘頭。
Oh, that's annoying! 有點煩呢！

3. planet 地球
What's the point? 有什麼意義？
The planet won't get better. 地球又不會變好。
It's for saving electricity. 是為了省電。

4. electricity 電力
Electricity should be used. 電就是要用的。
Or how about we meet tomorrow morning? 那我們明天早上碰面如何？
Alright. 好啦。

vocabulary.postscript:
跟我一起讀讀單字吧。
tonight 今晚
turn off 關掉
planet 地球；行星
electricity 電力

quiz.question: 1. When is Earth Hour today?
2. How long does Earth Hour last?
3. What does the Nanliao Community reuse as decorations?

content.en: Have you ever seen a lightning storm? It's weather that can be very scary.
content.tw: 你看過雷暴嗎？這種天氣感覺很恐怖。

content.en: First, you see dark clouds in the sky and lots of rain. Then the clouds make loud noises. This noise is thunder.
content.tw: 你會先看到烏雲密布、然後下起大雨，雲裡面還會有轟隆隆的雷聲。

content.en: Before you hear the thunder, you see a very fast white light. It comes down from the sky to the earth. This light is lightning.
content.tw: 在聽到雷聲之前，你會先看到閃電。

content.en: Lightning is electricity. In your home, you need electricity. It is safe. As lightning, it's dangerous. It can hit trees, buildings, or even people.
content.tw: 閃電是一種電，就像家裡用的電，不過閃電很危險，可能會打到樹、房屋，或是人。

content.en: Is there a way to control lightning? We don't want it to hurt anybody. Scientists in Europe found how to control it. They use lasers!
content.tw: 歐洲的科學家找到了一種可以控制閃電的方法，那就是雷射！

content.en: They went to a mountain in Switzerland. When a storm came, the scientists shot a laser into the clouds.
content.tw: 他們跑到瑞士的山上，暴風雨來的時候，他們對著烏雲發射雷射。

content.en: The lightning did not hit any buildings or people. It followed the laser.
content.tw: 結果閃電跟著雷射跑，沒有打到任何房屋或是人。

content.en: The scientists are happy. Their test went so well! Lasers can control lightning. They hope lasers will make the world safer. In the future, we won't fear dangerous lightning. When a lightning storm comes, we can use a laser to control lightning!
content.tw: 科學家們很高興。他們的測試進行得非常順利！雷射可以控制閃電。他們希望雷射能讓世界更安全。未來，我們將不再害怕危險的閃電。當雷暴來臨時，我們可以用雷射來控制閃電！

vocabulary.preface: 科學家用雷射做實驗，引導閃電避開地面。

content.text: 1. sky 天空。Where are we going this weekend? 我們這周末去哪裡？To the beach, to swim under the blue sky. 去海灘，在藍天下游泳。
2. weather 天氣。Are you sure we'll get a blue sky? 你確定會有藍天嗎？That's what the weatherman said. 氣象員是這麼說的。Sunny skies and high temperatures. 艷陽天，高溫。
3. cloud 雲層。We're getting nothing but rain and clouds, Jane! 什麼都沒有，只有雨跟雲！And thunder! 還有打雷！
4. safe 安全的。At least we're safe here in this beachside cafe. 至少我們在海邊咖啡館很安全。But what about our swim? 那我們的游泳呢？The storm should pass in no time. 風暴很快就過去的。

vocabulary.postscript: 下次閃電時你要注意看看喔！sky 天空 weather 天氣 cloud 雲層 safe 安全的

quiz.question: 1. What is the loud noise in a storm?
2. What will scientists use to control lightning?
3. Where did scientists try to control lightning?
